alert.note: Alert for Charles City; Chesterfield; City of Hopewell; City of Petersburg; Henrico; New Kent; Prince George (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 09 at 9:49PM EST until January 10 at 1:30AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM EST WEDNESDAY FOR SOUTHEASTERN CHESTERFIELD, SOUTHEASTERN HENRICO, NORTHWESTERN CHARLES CITY, NORTHWESTERN NEW KENT AND NORTHWESTERN PRINCE GEORGE COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF HOPEWELL AND THE EASTERN CITY OF PETERSBURG... At 949 PM EST, Heavy rain has moved out of the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Petersburg, Hopewell, Colonial Heights, Roxbury, Talleysville, Fort Gregg-Adams, Chester, Prince George, Jordans Point, Bottoms Bridge, Tunstall, Wayside, Glendale, Elko, Barnetts, Wrights Corner, Meadowville, Orapax Farms, Mountcastle and Jordan Point Country Club. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; Chesterfield; City of Hopewell; City of Petersburg; Henrico; New Kent; Prince George
